questions.question: Why are the Navigation Acts considered to be a main cause of the American Revolution?

choices.answer: Colonists resented Britain because they restricted trade.
The Navigation Acts placed a tax on all imported goods.
Colonists did not want to pay taxes without representation.
None of these

questions.question: Why did the Proclamation of 1763 create tension between Great Britain and the colonies?

choices.answer: Speculators purchased land out west and were denied access.
It put a tax on tea.
Colonists needed the king's permission to move west.
It put a tax on all paper products.

questions.question: Why was the Sugar Act passed by Parliament in 1764?

choices.answer: to stop smuggling between colonists & Colombia
to stop smuggling between colonists and Asian merchants
to stop smuggling between colonists & the French West Indies
to stop smuggling between the French & Native Americans

questions.question: On what did the Stamp Act place a tax?

choices.answer: It placed a tax on stamped clothing.
It placed a tax on stamps and coins.
It placed a tax on stamps and household items.
It placed a tax on almost all printed material.

questions.question: How did some colonists protest the Stamp Act?

choices.answer: They burned effigies which represented tax collectors.
They boycotted British and European goods.
Members of the Sons of Liberty protested in the streets.
People refused to use stamps.

questions.question: Why did the British believe the colonists would probably tolerate the Townshend Acts?

choices.answer: Townshend Acts taxed imported goods only.
Townshend Acts taxed products made and used in the colonies.

questions.question: Why did the relationship between Britain and the colonies begin to deteriorate?

choices.answer: The Proclamation of 1763 restricted freedom.
Colonists did not want to pay for the French and Indian War.
Colonists didn't believe in taxation without representation.
Colonists didn't like British troops being stationed there.

questions.question: How did women react to the Townshend Acts?

choices.answer: They organized groups to boycott British goods.
They sometimes called themselves the Daughters of Liberty.
Women did not participate in boycotting the Townshend Acts.
They urged others to wear only homemade fabric.
A movement based on the idea that reason could improve life
A European movement which called for absolute monarchy
A movement in Europe that called for European supremacy
None of these

questions.question: How did Benjamin Franklin exemplify the ideals of the Enlightenment?

choices.answer: He believed absolute monarchy would work best in society.
He believed in knowledge, reason, and science.
He believed reason could only be applied to religion.
None of these
